pullRequest.body:
- Two absolute values `v` and `w` are equivalent if and only if `v x < 1` exactly when `w x < 1`
- Two inequivalent absolute values `v` and `w` have a point `x` at which `1 < v x` and `w x < 1`
---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

### PR summary [5ca4865084](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22100/commits/5ca48650849bdd632485b32b68e1d17ebe2357c0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_one_iff_of_lt_one_iff`
`+ eq_one_of_lt_one_iff`
`+ exists_lt_one_one_le_of_not_isEquiv`
`+ exists_one_lt_lt_one_of_not_isEquiv`
`+ exists_rpow_of_one_lt`
`+ inv_lt_one_iff`
`+ inv_pos`
`+ isEquiv_iff_lt_one_iff`
`+ isNontrivial_iff_exists_abv_one_lt`
`+ log_div_image_eq_singleton_of_le_one_iff`
`+ lt_one_iff_of_lt_one_imp`
`+ mul_one_div_lt_iff`
`+ mul_one_div_pow_lt_iff`
`+ ne_zero_of_one_lt`
`+ nonpos_iff`
`+ one_add_pow_le`
`+ one_lt_iff_of_lt_one_iff`
`+ one_lt_of_lt_one_imp`
`+ one_sub_pow_le`
`+ pos_of_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Minigolf: 
```suggestion
theorem isNontrivial_iff_exists_abv_one_lt {F S : Type*} [Field F] [LinearOrderedField S]
    {v : AbsoluteValue F S} :
    v.IsNontrivial   x, 1 < v x := by
  refine fun h => h.exists_abv_gt_one, fun x, hx => x, ?_, ?_
   simp only [ne_eq, inv_eq_zero]; exact ne_zero_of_one_lt hx
   simpa only [map_inv, ne_eq, inv_eq_one] using ne_of_gt hx
```
Can this variable declaration be combined with the one below? (maybe moving some of the typeclass assumptions to the statements)
I think it makes sense in this case to move them entirely to the statement

```suggestion
  refine fun t, ht, h x => h  (Real.rpow_lt_one_iff' (w.nonneg x) ht), fun h => ?_
  obtain t, ht, hsuff := exists_rpow_of_one_lt hv h
  refine t, ht, funext fun x => ?_
  by_cases h : v x = 0
   rw [(map_eq_zero v).1 h, map_zero, map_zero, zero_rpow (by linarith)]
   by_cases h : v x = 1
     rw [h, (eq_one_iff_of_lt_one_iff h x).1 h, one_rpow]
     by_cases h : 0 < v x  v x < 1
       rw [ inv_inj,  map_inv v,  hsuff _ (map_inv v _  one_lt_inv_iff.2 h), map_inv,
          inv_rpow (w.nonneg _)]
       rw [ one_lt_inv_iff,  map_inv, not_lt] at h
        rw [ ne_eq,  inv_ne_one,  map_inv] at h
        exact hsuff _ <| (inv_lt_one_iff.1 <| lt_of_le_of_ne h h).resolve_left
          ((map_ne_zero v).1 h)
```

pullRequest.title: feat: two inequivalent absolute values have a `< 1` and `> 1` value

source.title: feat: collections of non-trivial and pairwise inequivalent absolute values contain values that diverge around 1
